On the same set of axes are drawn the graph of $ y=ax^2+bx+c$ and the graph of the equation obtained by replacing $ x$ by $ -x$ in the given equation.  If $ b \neq 0$ and $ c \neq 0$ these two graphs intersect:\\
\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ \text{in two points, one on the x-axis and one on the y-axis}\\
\textbf{(B)}\ \text{in one point located on neither axis} \\
\textbf{(C)}\ \text{only at the origin} \\
\textbf{(D)}\ \text{in one point on the x-axis} \\
\textbf{(E)}\ \text{in one point on the y-axis}$
